message: BUT

kind of a virtual presence in one.
@ericflo I could see a walled garden version very worth paying for.
Sure. That makes sense.
XMPP MUC support would be cool too.
I see you guys signing up :)
I totally think you should have a paid version available when you launch
gotcha
sure
We've still got some rough edges, but we're getting closer and closer to ready.
Curious what you guys think. /cc @HenrikJoreteg @Fritzy @adambrault
fair enough
Oh, that's cool! We're getting more and more into redis.
Well, I'll have to keep playing with it (this is my first post). The notification bar is a bit much (big), if you're looking for criticism.
I'm still exploring the features. :)
perhaps you shouldn't ;)
haha, this conversation cracks me up

Basically the problem is that right now we have no user-specific channel, we only have groupwide channels, and we store a decent amount of state in memory in the client...since there's no personal channel, it's impossible to know when you've done something in another tab.

Just doing everything very traditionally right now, didn't want to duplicate the template on client and server, so we decided to go either all-client or all-server. And we've got way more experience with all-server.
fair enough. also... you're using comet, yeah?

@mtrichardson Nice to see you in this convoresation. You guys are doing some great stuff at Urban Airship. Really cool to see your growth. We're a couple hours away and as I think @henrikjoreteg shared with @ericflo, we're looking to spawn a realtime web conference, which we'd be doing in your back yard ;) Any chance you'd be interested?
There's a fucking goddam MISSILE SILO that you can dive somewhere in eastern Washington or Oregon.
So basically that entire region has been redeemed in my eyes.
@Fritzy Ahh yeah, we definitely need to tweak stuff still
Pretty cool. I like the simplicity of it.
That's what we're aiming for :)
I think it's an off-by-one bug on clicking on growl messages near to the beginning of a conversation, I'll definitely track that one down.
@HenrikJoreteg Yeah, this is some custom Eventlet code I wrote, a very thin wrapper in front of Redis pub/sub
@mtrichardson I'll have to check it out, for right now I'm more comfortable keeping it in house, but it's worth investigating long term
Redis is the bees knees
Love it—the simplicity of the concept is great and it's pretty clear you've had a lot of attention to detail in the execution.
it's nice and clean
Some of our most valuable (and active) groups are private groups of friends and stuff
you can still give your friends free rooms...
or let people create 5 private groups, then pay for more
... or something
another question. So... i've got two tabs up at the moment. My other open tab still says I've got 25 unread items in this group. Any plans to sync that type of info?
it's always a tradeoff between "ideal" and "works for now"
Our Android stack is completely generic and could provide push notifications to anything. I keep meaning to buy a toaster-a-la-NetBSD and send pushes to it. PUSH TOAST YES NOW
@mtrichardson Terrific. I'll send you an email shortly.
Ahh... right. So where do you dive?
Holy crap. It's 2am on the west coast. First time in Europe and I have decided this whole other-side-of-the-planet thing is bizarre.
@ericflo I can imagine!
Kind of a mix between forums and chat.
But simple.
We did catch a bug just now. Nathan is sitting next to me and his post did not show up on my screen, but it did show up on Henrik's.
Whoa, that is quite a bug

@adambrault We have ideas for how we'll make money in the future, one of those ideas is providing some enhanced privacy beyond what we provide for private groups, but we have other ideas too.  For now everything is free :)
Yea
We respectfully disagree :)
Right now the goal is to grow, grow grooooooow
Yeah, we eventually want to sync that up
It's probably going to be a feature post-launch though
plus one million
@ericflo, yeah, essentially I view comet as any non-BOSH long-polling. Not sure that's quite accurate.
@ericflo Oh, completely - this would definitely be more in the "Let's see what we can do!" side of the house than "Actually use in production"
@mtrichardson That might work great. We're just a couple hours away from you. How about we come by for a visit sometime?
@mtrichardson Tri-Cities :)
BC?
@mtrichardson Oh wow.
@mtrichardson Yeah, I think there's a *ton* of great stuff that could come from a conference like this.
@adambrault That's the single design decision that has impacted the rest of the site, it's actually been a pain implementation-wise, but we think it's worth it, so it's great to hear that feedback.
Yeah, I wish YouTube offered an SSL embedding option
Does it show up on a refresh?
Yep—it's there on refresh.
Seriously though, I really love this idea. I can immediately see how it fills an interesting gap between Twitter, Quora, and group chat.
The favicon reminds me of Tycho of Penny-Arcade's blue stripe shirt.  http://www.penny-arcade.com/comic/2011/2/4/
Do you have thoughts or plans for a premium version?
We actually already provide walled garden for free
haha
lol seriously!
Why not make money from day one?
:D
They wouldn't pay for a private group
or shortly thereafter
We've got plenty of ideas on how to make money from this thing, later :)
sure
So a quick fix would be to add a poll on unread topics/groups
At some point we'll have to make the decision on whether to do the quick fix or the right fix, haha
and I'll add "punt and do it right later"
I noticed you're rendering ajax snippets on the server, any reason to not just do it on the client?
Wait, you can use convore sober?!
@HenrikJoreteg We're using...a comet technique.  My understanding is that comet is a generic term for real-time web stuff.
@ericflo You know, you could use our push backend for this stuff. If you run into scaling issues, let us know - we might want to do it just to prove the tech.
Hah, how so?
but, I don't know better  ;)
(Southeastern Washington)
@mtrichardson Not sure how to parse that last sentence :) Sorry.
@adambrault Absolutely. 100%. Hell, we'll host it in Portland if you want.
We have an amazing space that's been perfect for large gatherings - about 25,000 square feet. We sublet to BankSimple, Cloud Four and Uncorked, with a substantial meeting area set aside.
@adambrault Hah. Did my research. Real time conference for the win - sounds like we have a lot of knowledge we can share.
@adambrault Absolutely. Any time.  You're in... what... Seattle?
@adambrault Let's make a day of it. michael@urbanairship.com - let me know what days work for you and we'll make sure to make the trip worthwhile.
haha
http://www.hiphopsite.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/Jay-Z_Beyonce_British_Talk_Show_Marriage_jokes.jpg
@adambrault shhhh, you're reminding me that I have work soon.
@adambrault fucking weekdays, how do they work
@ericflo oh thank god that didn't happen
I'm not sure I have enough PBR for tonight
@ericflo Honestly... .... ... ... I don't even know where to begin. You just need to come here. To Portland. To understand.
@ericflo (also you're a douche, no facetime? wtf?)
@ericflo It's from Apple! It's not crap! It's FROM THE MOTHERSHIP
@ericflo ditto. THE DREAM IS COLLAPSING. G'night :)
oh shit. my dive shop just told me they could get me a BC in by our next dive trip. god fucking dammit, that's like $600 down the fucking drain.
@adambrault Mostly Hoodsport, WA. Six hours of driving for two hours of diving.
@ericflo I love it too. The entire site feels like a very interactive, intelligent IRC session (in the best way imaginable).
@adambrault win. Shit, @ericflo, look what you've done!
@adambrault Buoyancy Compensator/ Buoyancy Control Device. It's a vest with inflatable packets that you use to control your buoyancy while diving.
@adambrault So, dive trip combo seeing you guys - totally doable. ....what do you do?
@mtrichardson but it was a late night with a lot of Belgian beer last night and not enough sleep, so I'm not quite sharp at the moment. :)
I can't fucking believe Beyonce is with Jay-Z. That's just bullshit.
!dm @ericflo
That's what convore needs - a global karma tracking system (!dm is how to you dekarma people with our IRC bot)
@mtrichardson lol I'll be more careful next time.
Wait is today the weekend or a weekday?
After leaving Mochi to work on this full-time, I've lost all sense of time.
@ericflo you, sir, are a dick.

@ericflo I gotta say, the coolest detail I'm absolutely in love with is the scrollbar being stuck to the browse window but only impacting the conversation. So absolutely brilliant. Just thrilled me to see it, honestly. I'm totally gonna use that! :)
"ERIC FLO IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR FACETIME"
@ericflo Some of us are being irresponsible and staying up late. Thanks for reminding us.
@ericflo But you seriously need YouTube embedded videos - it's really way too hard to spam people with Beyonce videos as it is.
@ericflo You just became my hero. I didn't even notice that this was all over SSL. And that YouTube is a dick for not doing that.
HOLY SHIT http://www.isittimetocallericflo.com/
zomg
turns out you can buy inception on Amazon

Backstory: a couple of people - not naming names here - got really, really, really drunk one night on Molson's and were hanging out on IRC and realized that what was missing from their lives was @ericflo. So, they called him up! And he woke up and answered the phone. Then, he couldn't get back to sleep so he got back online. The people involved felt kind of bad, but obviously not that bad, because they made a tradition out of it. And for every day for like a week they called ericflo some time between 2 and 4 AM.
INCEPTION
Holy crap, look at the time, I can't be staying up this late when I have relatively important stuff going on tomorrow
G'night guys
(have you noticed my restraint in not calling ericflo yet?)
As I remember it, we had some hilarious conversation online too.
That's really really funny.

FaceTime is pretty awesome, also that it's for the Mac. My girl doesn't have an iPhone 4, but is typically on her Mac when I wake up in the morning (9 timezones ahead), so thanks to FT we can quickly chat for a bit.
Exactly. (my girl is British)
(and usually drunk at that time of night)
@ericflo I don't remember any of that.
See if we had been talking on Convore we could go back and look at it
But...it's actually probably a really good thing we weren't on Convore
...so that just happened
@mtrichardson No I think you need to keep going, because our night gets more entertaining the more PBR you drink
Android
@ericflo There's a version for the Mac.http://www.apple.com/mac/facetime/ You're not running fucking Ubuntu, are you? Hippie?
I'm on mac, but I don't want to download more crap :P
@KuraFire I generally use it to drunk-chat British and/or New Zealand people.
@KuraFire perfect.
@KuraFire I've found that British people are usually drunk at any time of night.
Or day, half the time. It’s a core ingredient of their efficiency as a nation.
The best part about Inception is that the old Japanese guy is the young sidekick from Tampopo, which is also (like Inception) the best movie ever.
